caption: It’s real Italian food in Harlem!
here good

What a warm and cozy restaurant to enjoy a wonderful atmosphere & great food "however" you want it. The service was cordial and attentive. A clean environment with a sense of care for their influence. The wine was traditional, the moment was special and "rememorable". I will be returning there soon. No driving this time cause too many cars in the area. I'm grateful with "no" regrets to have chosen L'Artista.

I love L’Artista food, service and hospitality. This place has authentic Italian food (seafood pasta, tuna tartar & pizza are my favs) everything is made with love including the drinks!  Oh and if you want to learn how to speak/pronounce some Italian words you have an audio translator projecting it in the restroom area - awesome idea! 😊
The food is phenomenal. My favorite dish is the tuna with avocado - nice and light. Love that they are making this a center of culture, music, poetry, etc in the neighborhood, too!

L'artista is a welcoming and cozy yet sophisticated place. I had such a great time in the backyard seating area eating delicious food and sipping wonderful wine "al fresco"! They have free concerts on Sundays and the sidewalk seating is lovely, all within a new pedestrian zone! (No noisy trucks right in front of your table all the time) The menu is inventive yet firmly rooted in the northern Italian tradition and changes on a regular basis depending on the season, which I appreciate. Great place for cocktails as well. Highly recommended!!

This has become our go-to spot in our neighborhood. Incredible but affordable food, the friendliest service, and a backyard patio with the most romantic, cozy atmosphere! We've been back several times after having brunch here and every experience has been fantastic! Brunch is has some amazing options (even for vegetarians like us) and dinner has great appetizers, salads, and fabulous pastas. So grateful for a place like this nearby with great, spaced out outdoor dining to make us feel safe during the pandemic while still enjoying a night out!

Yesterday visited L' Artista restaurant, let me tell you what a great food and service. I came looking for a beer but one of the staff named Monica recommended me one of her beer Menabrea which we loved it!! After drinking a couples of beer, thought getting some food so kindly Monica recommended us to get cozze in umido which were incredibly!! I definitely recommend this place, what a great service from Monica and food.

Our neighbors recommended L'Artista and we're so glad they did. We ate on the back patio which is lovely. The vegetarian sliders are the bomb!! I had the lemon ravioli which was delicious; hubby had the octopus. Thrilled they are in the neighborhood and definitely recommend!
What a delight to find this place in Hamilton Heights. Ambiance was terrific, and the service was attentive. Definitely give the vegetarian sliders a try!

Lovely place with great food, simple Italian menu with a hint of Spain, simple wine menu as well but you will find some wine to pair with your dishes. I tried few dishes and I loved them, I've been following shef German from his other restaurants and he has been consistent with the quality of his food. I tried the prosciutto with tomato and mozzarella and it was nice and fresh, tried the lamb and it was beautifully cooked with even temperature on both pieces, which is a sign of a skilled chef. Service might take some time, usually for me that knocks down the rating to 4 stars but I understand that things are not the same since the pandemic, other than that a nice restaurant with great atmosphere. Make sure to check the back area, it's quite and relaxing if you want to enjoy a conversation
The food and atmosphere are fabulous. While other places are full you will find a table and a warm welcome here.

L’artista deserves 5 starts!!!  The backyard is just magic, all those lights and set up make it more special. Food was very good, i also appreciated the service a lot!  Pizza was crunchy, pasta al dente!!!  I will be back for sure.

I opted for something light so I had the Salmon and a glass of Pinot Grigio. The wine was very nice, the salmon and vegetables grilled just right. The curbside seated worked out well because of the nice evening weather but they have a rear patio too see the photos. The service was excellent. And there are a few public benches near by if you want to sit and relax after dinner.

They just reopened with new owners. The atmosphere is lovely. The back patio is quiet with great lighting. The front outdoor seating area however borders the pedestrian outdoor space and can get distracting. There was a birthday party happening 10 feet from the restaurant's front outdoor space. Also a group of people were sitting very close to the restaurant tables and I was confused for a moment because I thought they were having dinner, but realized they pulled up a table and some chairs and were just hanging out a few feet away from some diners.  The food is meh. Truffle fries were a good texture, but only got a few pieces with truffle oil so that was disappointing. The frittura di pesce (fried seafood) appetizer's texture was good, but it was made of frozen seafood. Mussels tasted fishy and disintegrated in my mouth. For an $18 appetizer, you're expecting fresh seafood. The pulpo was actually cooked and seasoned well, although a small portion. The linguine al frutti di mare was bad!  They used the same frozen seafood mix that they used for the frittura di pesce and the sauce was very basic tomato sauce with few distinguishing flavors. Again, at $23, they can at least afford fresh seafood... And it wasn't even linguine (it was spaghetti)! Pasta was cooked well (al dente) but was a boxed pasta (which would be fine if they didn't use cheap frozen seafood mix).  Service was overall just ok. The waitstaff was very nice, however service was very slow and we had to go find them to put in a dinner order.  I'd come back for drinks and maybe an appetizer, but would not recommend a full dinner service.
The food was great. Syrup for the pancakes had a weird taste that doesn't remind you of a homestyle syrup. Overall had a nice experience

I really like this place, and since I live in the neighborhood, I want to support their business. However, yesterday, my husband and I went to this restaurant, and the staff wasn’t wearing masks! I felt so uncomfortable that it actually ruin my night! They know they should be wearing them all the time, right?  I should have said something, but I didn’t. I think I afraid, maybe felt embarrassed, or I felt bad because I thought perhaps I was overreacting. But after talking to my husband and walking around the neighborhood last night, checking on how other bars and restaurants are handling this “new normal,” I realized I wasn’t wrong. It is absolutely irresponsible and rude that this place is not following the protocols. So please, if the manager reads this review, ask your staff to comply with the rules and wear their mask! I don't think I’ll be coming back until I see they are wearing the mask!
European style. Cozy and friendly. Tasty too.
I don’t know what to says about kitchen and server Amazing place

I love this restaurant so much! Can not rave about it enough! The atmosphere is inviting and beautiful, and the staff are so great. My fiancé and I sat at the bar right next to the open kitchen and had wonderful conversations with the chef who was very accommodating to my dietary restrictions. Love that the head chef is a woman, and she even gave us a complimentary dessert, flourless chocolate cake which I can not recommend enough!!!! We will be going back here as soon as possible and hope you do too!
Such a wonderful service! Food was delicious and the atmosphere was so cozy. Definitely going back to try their drinks
Excellent food and a thoughtful wine list but what really stands out is the staff. Wishing you the best of luck. Amazing addition to the neighborhood!

Great atmosphere! Good food! Amazing staff! Moises really has a vision for the place and follows through with the concept of the restaurant! The menu Moises and the staff worked on gives people a bit of everything. The cocktails are unique! Very detailed and Moises really enforces the importance of presentation! Makes everyone feel welcomed! Works with people to satisfy them and make sure their experience is a positive one. Worth going in to eat or drink. If Moises isn’t there your experience is still a great off due to the genuineness of the staff!  Edit: new ownership, they should delete all the old yelp and google reviews since 98% of these reviews are from L’Argot and not L’ARTISTA.

They're new, so I hope they keep up the ambiance, but the best part has to be what's on the drinks menu. This place is different, and each drink has its own little backstory of creation. The bartender makes the drinks with care, so you're not just having a drink, but having one of his pieces of art. Workers are attentive and friendly. Coming  here to relax after a long day is ideal. Such a nice place

What a beautiful find on a rainy, cold December night!  The moment my friend entered the lovely, intimate, warm L'Artista.  there were amazing aromas (,the short ribs with rosemary).  The owner, Frederico, was so friendly and knowledgeable about the menu and wine offerings, and the history of that slice of Hamilton Ave.  The mushroom lasagne was delicious, the nutella tiramisu something I'll be craving my next return.  The prices were do reasonable for such quality too!  Will definitely return, esp. As live music starts in January.
The restaurant was amazing, but without the original staff, it isn't the same. Food is great, but the friendly staff made the experience worth it.
its a great place. Im glad is in the area!!!
An absolutely amazing place with an upscale feel and impeccable charm. The drinks were phenomenal and the dining experience was top class. Would recommend to everyone!
Wonderful Service and Ambiance! I highly suggest a visit to L'Argot Harlem if you are looking for great eats, great wine and great vibes. Great addition to Harlem!👍💛👏

This place is absolutely amazing. The drinks are upscale the environment is quaint and the food is delicious. Something new to the area that was very much needed. I will definitely be back again and again!!!!!
The energy here is amazing!! The food and service are great!!
My new favorite spot. Excellent vibe, live music, food and drinks❤️

Very cute and cozy place! I especially like the outdoor area in the back! Our waitress was super kind and warm. I ordered the churrasco and mashed potatoes for dinner, and she informed me that there is cheese in the potatoes. No problem! The food arrived and there was bleu cheese in the potatoes! I was expecting anything but that. Interesting flavor that I hated but didn't say anything since I was told cheese, just not specifically bleu cheese. The steak was a lunch portion at dinner, but decent in flavor!
Great
The live performances on a Sunday afternoon was a great touch!
Great service, excellent food and beautiful setting.
Small, limited menu
Great drinks and service. The plantain chips and guacamole were below average.
We've been to L'Argot twice now, and had several items from the menu. The food has all been excellent, the service super friendly, with a nice overall vibe. This is a wonderful spot, all around!
I had salmon, brussel sprouts and mashed potatoes. Great food and nice, peaceful atmosphere. I would definitely recommend this place.
Enjoying the new front Patio at L'Argot, Amazing place great food and great customer service!

Excellent new restaurant, with delicious food and top quality ingredients. The owner, Daniel, has such a clear passion for the place and his personality shines through it, including concerts he often puts on at the weekend. Don't miss it!
A++ location and food
Loved it, nice cozy atmosphere and lovely outdoor space
Super friendly staff and the food was excellent

Pleasant bar/bistro vibe. Spotted this place as I walked home, stepped in to check out the menu and decided to stay. Met a wonderful bartender who made the most exotic cocktail with mezcal. Very surprised at the refinement of the menu.  Had dinner and started with their grilled octopus. My mouth watered as they took it off the grill. Once I took a bite I was sold. Succulent and chard in all the right places. Continued with their 10oz burger and ate it rare. It was amazing.  Whole experience made me smile. Glad to see Sugar Hills developed a smooth and charming dining scene. If you are looking for a new spot that delivers L’Argot is the place.  Have gone back several times since and experience the same hospitality. Their wait staff and bartenders are knowledgeable and serve with tendered kindness.
Good service and great atmosphere. Eat outside in the the rear of the restaurant.
Amazing food and great service. The staff is very friendly and attentive.

This was our second time at L'Argot. The first time it was on a weekend for a brunch and it was delicious. This time it was for dinner, also delicious. For a starter, we had a guacamole with plantain chips (instead of tortilla chips), excellent combination. The service was excellent, the atmosphere warm and welcoming. Good news! They were getting the back courtyard ready with tables and flower pots so soon it will be open! They also have live jazz certain days.
This place has no Harlem feel to it. Gentrification at it's finest.(and the food is not good and those not reflect OUR neighborhood )#HarlemIsFillingUpWithRecessiveGeneCaveDwellers
Amazing food and drinks. Love the fact they make the food right by the bar. The octopus was fresh and tasty. The bartender made amazing whiskey theme cocktails. Will revisit.

I think everyone in the neighborhood should visit L' Argot. The place is perfect for a night out, chatting with friends, dating, etc. I love their food especially their burgers. The drinks are a whole different level, I never had a bloody marry like the one they serve. The atmosphere is positive and the bartender is super cool. Not a loud music, perfect to had a conversation with someone else. The place is clean and organized, I visited the place 4 times already I will highly recommend it

Love having a new, casual hangout in the neighborhood! The cocktails are amazing. If you are a Mezcal fan, try the Negroni. You won't be disappointed! The menu offers something for everyone. I will definitely make this one of my regular stops!
Hot Spot
Excellent food and cocktails.  Open late, friendly neighborhood restaurant and bar.
Small. Quaint. Succulent
Great place and atmosphere, the food is delicious and beautiful. Fresh and tasty. Great service. It is going to be a favorite in the area..
Nice food. Good addition to the neighborhood selection.  We were a bit confused by the theme: French name, Spanish menu sections, German messages on the walls, European music, etc
Details pending.

Amazing new place in the neighborhood! Extremely friendly staff and very interesting mix of European and American food. Wine, french onion soup, wings, paninis and creme brulee are delicious! The atmosphere and music make the place very comfortable.
SUPER friendly staff. Highly recommend getting the burger...
Great little place. Food was delicious, particularly the tuna tartare, as well as the cocktails. Small, but nice wine selection.
Terrific place. Cozy atmosphere, good craft cockatils and excellent food. Will become a destination!

This restaurant is phenomenal!!! SO glad it opened in our neighborhood- great atmosphere and place to be. Would most certainly recommend. Owner is lovely, food is excellent and the passion fruit drinks are spectacular! Best burger in town!
